alert.note: Alert for Southern Seward Peninsula Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 26 at 6:23AM AKDT until March 27 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow, blowing snow, and freezing rain. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 14 inches, and ice accumulations a light glaze. Winds gusting to 35 mph. * WHERE...Southern Seward Peninsula Coast. * WHEN...Until 4 AM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest winds and worst conditions have already occured. Winds and blowing snow should taper off this afternoon. Areas of freezing rain will occur this morning. Snow will taper off at Nome this afternoon, and snow will taper off at Golvin this evening.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. This will make travel very difficult or impossible.
